sense.gloss: to glide, to slide (e.g. on skis), to slip
to fail (an examination), to bomb (when telling a joke)
to drop, to go down, to come down, to fall (e.g. in status)
to make a slip of the tongue, to let something slip
shifting to another post (at the same level), sideways move (at a company)

sdata.j: ↑突然↑↓とつぜん↓に↑玄関↑↓げんかん↓のベルが↑鳴↑↓な↓って、↑一人↑↓ひとり↓の↑黒↑↓くろ↓い↑男性↑↓だんせい↓の↑影↑↓かげ↓が↑静↑↓しず↓かに↑辷↑↓すべ↓り↑込↑↓こ↓んで↑来↑↓き↓ました。
sdata.e: All of a sudden, the front door bell rang and the dark shadow of a lone man slipped in quietly.

words.gloss: to glide, to slide (e.g. on skis), to slip
